The problem:

Working with auto-layout in Figma is great, but it doesn't allow you to have different spacing/padding for different components in an auto-layout setting.


I often found myself adding different padding/spacing in order to match the padding/spacing visually coherent. There are workarounds with auto-layout but it's not great. There has to be a better way. Say hello to Spacer!


What is Spacer?

Spacer is nothing more than a set of square blocks that you can use with auto-layout to give desired padding/spacing to elements with its surroundings.


How they can help?

Spacers are super helpful in:

  • Setting different padding/spacing for different components and in relation to each other.
  • Changing padding on the fly for single or multiple components without finding workarounds with auto-layout.
  • Communicating padding visually to devs or designers on the team.


Checkout the examples in the file to learn more.
